intro: Lacandonia, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a genus of flowering plants native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in warm, sunny environments. Lacandonia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and drought tolerance. Some species are also used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits.
